utACK 41e58faf043864a64a6db08a8df527fa5fd1ec5b\nAny reason to keep `CHECKSUM_SIZE = sizeof(int)` (`protocol.h`) instead of just `CHECKSUM_SIZE = 4`?\n

> Any reason to keep `CHECKSUM_SIZE = sizeof(int)` (`protocol.h`) instead of just `CHECKSUM_SIZE = 4`?

Yes, I thought about that too, we **know** that the checksum is always four bytes and it shouldn't change based on what happens to be the architectures int type. WIll do.

Edit: Done. Also changed the SIZE_SIZE to be a fixed-size uint32_t the same go. We already use `WriteLE32` at the packet
A size check of `hash.size() <=  CMessageHeader::CHECKSUM_SIZE` is probably a total overkill...\n
A compile-time assertion could be added... But I don't think there is any risk of someone increasing `CHECKSUM_SIZE` larger than 32 in practice.\n
